title: ‘Unaffordable and nearly unlivable’: What readers want Mayor Wu and City Councilors to prioritize
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers prioritize housing affordability, public safety, and infrastructure for the upcoming Boston mayoral and City Council elections.
Concerns include high rents, inadequate public transit, and safety issues around Massachusetts Avenue and Melnea Cass Boulevard.
Immigration policy divides, with calls for more support for newcomers versus reallocating resources to other areas.

title: Business confidence in Massachusetts drops again, report says
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Massachusetts business confidence declined in October due to rising prices, government disruptions, and tariff uncertainties, per the AIM Index.
The Associated Industries of Massachusetts reported the business confidence index has been negative for eight months, longest since 2020.
Economist Alan Clayton-Matthews noted federal policy changes impact state productivity, emphasizing issues like tariffs and reduced R&D.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce date of 2026 home opener
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Legacy FC will play its first NWSL regular season game on March 14, 2026, at Gillette Stadium.
The team's home opener will be broadcast nationally, but the opponent has not been announced yet.
Boston Legacy FC has signed nine players and aims to meet the league's 18-player minimum roster size.

title: Six straight wins later — are the Patriots officially back?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The New England Patriots, under new head coach Mike Vrabel, have achieved a six-game win streak.
Rookie quarterback Drake Maye has led the team to a 7-2 record, entering the NFL MVP conversation.
Stefon Diggs, Rhamondre Stevenson, and DeMario Douglas have contributed to the Patriots' promising performance.

title: New UMass poll shows Markey with firm lead over Moulton
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: New UMass poll shows Sen. Ed Markey leading Rep. Seth Moulton 51% to 28% in Massachusetts Democratic primary.
Markey's lead narrows to 35% if Rep. Ayanna Pressley enters the race, with Pressley at 21% and Moulton at 25%.
Poll indicates 66% support making Election Day a state holiday and 62% support voter ID requirements in Massachusetts.

title: Mass. man missing after leaving hospital early Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Leonard Mercury, 57, went missing after leaving Heywood Hospital in Gardner, Massachusetts at 2 a.m. on Friday.
Police report Mercury was last seen wearing hospital clothing and no shoes, heading toward a nearby bike path.
Authorities urge anyone with information to contact Gardner police at 978-632-5600, advising against approaching Mercury.

title: ‘We’re feeling that first-snow magic’: New England ski resorts delight in the season’s first snow
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: First snow of the season fell at New England ski resorts, sparking excitement and social media posts from officials.
Bretton Woods in New Hampshire and Jay Peak in Vermont announced their respective openings on November 28.
Stowe Mountain Resort and Killington began snowmaking operations, with Stowe set to open on November 22.

title: 5 new restaurants we’re excited to try in November
author: Jillian Dara
bullets: Florentine sandwich shop All’Antico Vinaio opens its latest location in Boston's Back Bay, known for its Tuscan Schiacciata bread.
Capricho Colombian Steakhouse by Vanessa Dorta and Carlos Andrés Gómez Porras opens in West Roxbury, offering Colombian-inspired dishes.
Twisted Fate Brewing debuts its second taproom in Suffolk Downs' Beachmont Square, featuring New England IPAs and a new onsite restaurant.

title: Former Gov. Charlie Baker’s father dies at 97
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Charles D. Baker III, father of former Gov. Charlie Baker, passed away at age 97 in Needham.
Baker III was a former government official and served as president of consulting firm Harbridge House.
He taught at Northeastern University and was a trusted adviser to his son during his governorship.

title: Falcons accused Patriots of illegal simulation of a snap on crucial fourth quarter play
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Falcons head coach Raheem Morris accused the Patriots of illegal snap simulation during a critical fourth-quarter play.
Atlanta quarterback Michael Penix Jr. alleged the Patriots mimicked his clapping, causing an unplanned snap and subsequent penalty.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel joked about the allegations, referring to them as "Clapgate" during a radio interview.
